posts.html:
Web3Universe.today is an independent publication launched in January 2023 by Mahesh Chand. If you subscribe today, you'll get full access to the website as well as email newsletters about new content when it's available. Your subscription makes this site possible, and allows Web3Universe to continue to exist. Thank you!

Access all areas

By signing up, you'll get access to the full archive of everything that's been published before and everything that's still to come. Your very own private library.

Fresh content, delivered

Stay up to date with new content sent straight to your inbox! No more worrying about whether you missed something because of a pesky algorithm or news feed.

Meet people like you

Join a community of other subscribers who share the same interests.

Web3Universe.today is an independent publication launched in January 2023 by Mahesh Chand. If you subscribe today, you'll get full access to the website as well as email newsletters about new content when it's available. Your subscription makes this site possible, and allows Web3Universe to continue to exist. Thank you!


Access all areas

By signing up, you'll get access to the full archive of everything that's been published before and everything that's still to come. Your very own private library.


Fresh content, delivered

Stay up to date with new content sent straight to your inbox! No more worrying about whether you missed something because of a pesky algorithm or news feed.


Meet people like you

Join a community of other subscribers who share the same interests.

posts.html:
Introduction

The future of the internet is a hot topic right now, but what exactly does it look like? Web3 is a set of new technologies that will change how we interact with the web. It will combine features from current platforms and make them even more powerful.

What is Web3?

Web3 is the next era of the internet, and it’s already here.

It’s decentralized, open-source, peer-to-peer network that has been built from scratch to support DApps. These applications use smart contracts (aka self-executing code) to power all kinds of new technologies for users, like decentralized exchanges for cryptocurrencies or prediction markets for finance.

We call this new global computer web3 because it serves as a platform for these apps; think of it like an operating system for your digital world.

The internet is broken. It’s a centralized system owned by a handful of massive corporations that harvest your data and sell it for profit. They control the flow of information, which skews everything from politics to culture, and they are constantly looking for ways to squeeze more money out of you.

Projections for Web3

The Web 3.0 market is expected to be a $100 trillion industry by 2030, according to research from Blockchain Intelligence Group (BIG). The report also predicts that the blockchain sector will be worth $1 trillion by 2022 and $30 trillion by 2023, with growth slowing thereafter.

The following year, however, BIG expects a rebound in growth with a projected valuation of $20 trillion for 2025.

The report, titled “Blockchain Technology Market Analysis and Forecasts to 2030,” was published on Aug. 2 by BIG and predicts that the blockchain industry will grow by $10 trillion over the next 10 years.

The Metaverse

The Metaverse is the name given to a digital world that will exist on top of the internet. It's a virtual reality that you can access with your smartphone and VR headset, but it's also much more than just an interactive game. The metaverse will be a place where people can meet and interact, buy or sell goods from each other, and create new communities through their own personal spaces in this vast digital world.

The metaverse is essentially built on top of our already existing technology—the internet. Think about it: when you browse websites and apps on your phone or computer today, those websites are hosted by servers somewhere else in the world (you might not even know where they are). These servers connect you to other users through what we call "the cloud." This means there are computers somewhere hosting these virtual worlds for all of us to experience—and there will continue to be even when we enter into them ourselves!

The metaverse will be a virtual reality that you can access with your smartphone and VR headset, but it's also much more than just an interactive game. The metaverse will be a place where people can meet and interact, buy or sell goods from each other, and create new communities through their own personal spaces in this vast digital world.

As we move into this new era of technology and virtual reality, we need to be aware that there are many ethical considerations that must be made. We have already seen how VR can be used for violent and harmful purposes: the recent school shooting in Florida was live-streamed on Facebook, for example.

NFTs (Non-fungible tokens)

So what is an NFT? To start, they're not just a way to tokenize art. The term NFT stands for "non-fungible token," meaning that each item will have its own unique history and characteristics (like a fingerprint).

The benefits are numerous: whether you're selling a piece of art or a digital asset like CryptoKitties (which allows users to breed and collect their own crypto kitties), you can use the blockchain to track ownership information, but also build in smart contracts that help automate transactions. This means less friction when it comes to buying and selling assets—with fewer middlemen involved in the process!

To create an NFT, you need two things: an ERC-721 token standard contract (a specific type of Ethereum blockchain smart contract) and an interface that lets users interact with/buy/sell your tokens using ether as payment.

There are also a few other important things to note: - NFTs do not require gas fees, unlike ERC-20 tokens. - They can be used on any blockchain platform, not just Ethereum.

- They can be used to represent any type of asset, not just art. - NFTs are currently only available on the Ethereum blockchain.

-They are only available on the Ethereum blockchain.

Cryptocurrency

Cryptocurrency is a digital currency that uses cryptography to secure transactions and control the creation of new units. Cryptocurrency is decentralized, meaning it’s not controlled by any bank or government. Because of this, you can make a transaction without going through a third party like PayPal or Venmo.

Cryptocurrencies are not backed by any government or central bank; instead, they're supported by their use as payment for goods and services on the internet (or "in-world"). When someone buys digital coins online using real money from an online exchange market—like Coinbase—they're known as "newbies" because they didn't mine their own cryptocurrency with specialized computers that solve complex math problems in order to generate digital money. Newbies pay miners who solve those puzzles so they can get paid in newly generated tokens instead of spending time trying to do it themselves!

3D Graphics

3D graphics are used in many different applications, including video games, virtual reality and augmented reality (for example, mapping). When you visualize the world through a 3D graphic you can see things that normally would be invisible such as shadows or reflections. This makes it easier to understand and analyze objects in the real world.

In addition, 3D graphics have been used for several decades now to create models of objects which can then be printed using 3D printers.

Web3 will provide the infrastructure for the next era of digital transformation.

Web3 will be the next generation of the internet. It’s a decentralized, peer-to-peer network that enables people to connect directly and build great things together. As opposed to today’s web experience, Web3 will be a decentralized web where users don’t need to rely on centralized data centers or businesses for their computing needs. Instead, they can find each other on peer-to-peer networks and exchange value through cryptocurrencies (e.g., Ether).

The future of digital transformation isn't going to happen from within our current systems—it'll happen when we disrupt them with new models like those enabled by Web3

Conclusion

Web3 is an exciting technology that will change the way we interact with the internet. The possibilities are endless and it's hard to predict what will happen next. What I can tell you is that Web3 will provide the infrastructure for the next era of digital transformation.
posts.plaintext:
Introduction

The future of the internet is a hot topic right now, but what exactly does it look like? Web3 is a set of new technologies that will change how we interact with the web. It will combine features from current platforms and make them even more powerful.


What is Web3?

Web3 is the next era of the internet, and it’s already here.

It’s decentralized, open-source, peer-to-peer network that has been built from scratch to support DApps. These applications use smart contracts (aka self-executing code) to power all kinds of new technologies for users, like decentralized exchanges for cryptocurrencies or prediction markets for finance.

We call this new global computer web3 because it serves as a platform for these apps; think of it like an operating system for your digital world.

The internet is broken. It’s a centralized system owned by a handful of massive corporations that harvest your data and sell it for profit. They control the flow of information, which skews everything from politics to culture, and they are constantly looking for ways to squeeze more money out of you.


Projections for Web3

The Web 3.0 market is expected to be a $100 trillion industry by 2030, according to research from Blockchain Intelligence Group (BIG). The report also predicts that the blockchain sector will be worth $1 trillion by 2022 and $30 trillion by 2023, with growth slowing thereafter.

The following year, however, BIG expects a rebound in growth with a projected valuation of $20 trillion for 2025.

The report, titled “Blockchain Technology Market Analysis and Forecasts to 2030,” was published on Aug. 2 by BIG and predicts that the blockchain industry will grow by $10 trillion over the next 10 years.


The Metaverse

The Metaverse is the name given to a digital world that will exist on top of the internet. It's a virtual reality that you can access with your smartphone and VR headset, but it's also much more than just an interactive game. The metaverse will be a place where people can meet and interact, buy or sell goods from each other, and create new communities through their own personal spaces in this vast digital world.

The metaverse is essentially built on top of our already existing technology—the internet. Think about it: when you browse websites and apps on your phone or computer today, those websites are hosted by servers somewhere else in the world (you might not even know where they are). These servers connect you to other users through what we call "the cloud." This means there are computers somewhere hosting these virtual worlds for all of us to experience—and there will continue to be even when we enter into them ourselves!

The metaverse will be a virtual reality that you can access with your smartphone and VR headset, but it's also much more than just an interactive game. The metaverse will be a place where people can meet and interact, buy or sell goods from each other, and create new communities through their own personal spaces in this vast digital world.

As we move into this new era of technology and virtual reality, we need to be aware that there are many ethical considerations that must be made. We have already seen how VR can be used for violent and harmful purposes: the recent school shooting in Florida was live-streamed on Facebook, for example.


NFTs (Non-fungible tokens)

So what is an NFT? To start, they're not just a way to tokenize art. The term NFT stands for "non-fungible token," meaning that each item will have its own unique history and characteristics (like a fingerprint).

The benefits are numerous: whether you're selling a piece of art or a digital asset like CryptoKitties (which allows users to breed and collect their own crypto kitties), you can use the blockchain to track ownership information, but also build in smart contracts that help automate transactions. This means less friction when it comes to buying and selling assets—with fewer middlemen involved in the process!

To create an NFT, you need two things: an ERC-721 token standard contract (a specific type of Ethereum blockchain smart contract) and an interface that lets users interact with/buy/sell your tokens using ether as payment.

There are also a few other important things to note: - NFTs do not require gas fees, unlike ERC-20 tokens. - They can be used on any blockchain platform, not just Ethereum.

- They can be used to represent any type of asset, not just art. - NFTs are currently only available on the Ethereum blockchain.

-They are only available on the Ethereum blockchain.


Cryptocurrency

Cryptocurrency is a digital currency that uses cryptography to secure transactions and control the creation of new units. Cryptocurrency is decentralized, meaning it’s not controlled by any bank or government. Because of this, you can make a transaction without going through a third party like PayPal or Venmo.

Cryptocurrencies are not backed by any government or central bank; instead, they're supported by their use as payment for goods and services on the internet (or "in-world"). When someone buys digital coins online using real money from an online exchange market—like Coinbase—they're known as "newbies" because they didn't mine their own cryptocurrency with specialized computers that solve complex math problems in order to generate digital money. Newbies pay miners who solve those puzzles so they can get paid in newly generated tokens instead of spending time trying to do it themselves!


3D Graphics

3D graphics are used in many different applications, including video games, virtual reality and augmented reality (for example, mapping). When you visualize the world through a 3D graphic you can see things that normally would be invisible such as shadows or reflections. This makes it easier to understand and analyze objects in the real world.

In addition, 3D graphics have been used for several decades now to create models of objects which can then be printed using 3D printers.


Web3 will provide the infrastructure for the next era of digital transformation.

Web3 will be the next generation of the internet. It’s a decentralized, peer-to-peer network that enables people to connect directly and build great things together. As opposed to today’s web experience, Web3 will be a decentralized web where users don’t need to rely on centralized data centers or businesses for their computing needs. Instead, they can find each other on peer-to-peer networks and exchange value through cryptocurrencies (e.g., Ether).

The future of digital transformation isn't going to happen from within our current systems—it'll happen when we disrupt them with new models like those enabled by Web3


Conclusion

Web3 is an exciting technology that will change the way we interact with the internet. The possibilities are endless and it's hard to predict what will happen next. What I can tell you is that Web3 will provide the infrastructure for the next era of digital transformation.
